channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0522; 10:18AM; 229 E 66th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/4acDn3m; #Florence; The first 26 LAFD firefighters extinguished the one-story duplex attic fire in 26 minutes, protecting the living quarters below with a coordinated effort of inside salvage work (move/cover belongings to protect from water damage), rooftop ventilation, and interior fire attack. There were no reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 BC18 E21 E221 E233 E33 E57 RA33 RA857 SO1 SQ21 T21 T33; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0522; 09:52AM; 229 E 66th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/4acDn3m; #Florence; One-story duplex with fire in the attic. Offensive mode.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 BC18 E21 E221 E233 E33 E57 RA33 RA857 SO1 SQ21 T21 T33; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0423; 09:09AM; 1111 W 6th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48F4RxO; #Westlake; Firefighters responded to a vacant 41,840 square-foot four-story commercial structure built in 1967 to find smoke showing from the third floor (the site of a previous burn). Firefighters ascended ladders to the roof and balconies, and extended hose lines to the third floor via interior stairwells, despite thick smoke and hazards such as open elevator shafts. Crews discovered contents burning on the third floor and quickly extinguished the flames. Ultimately it took 36 firefighters 20 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames. Crews will remain on scene to evacuate the heavy smoke from the building using blowers. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E10 E203 E211 E3 E9 RA11 RA13 RA3 RA803 SO1 SQ21 T11 T3; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0423; 08:49AM; 1111 W 6th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48F4RxO; #Westlake; PRELIM: Four-story vacant commercial building (site of previous burn) with smoke showing from the third floor. Offensive mode.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 E10 E203 E211 E3 E9 RA11 RA3 RA803 SQ21 T11 T3; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1611; 10:47PM; 13574 W Gager St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TSw37k; #Pacoima; Firefighters responded to find heavy fire showing from a detached garage in the rear of a residential property. Flames were already shooting out through the roof, causing crews to fight the fire from the ground only. Firefighters deployed hose lines and used forcible entry techniques to open up the front of the garage, gaining access for hose streams. It took 32 firefighter 20 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames. One 15-year old female was found with burn injuries, treated by firefighter/paramedics, and transported to an area hospital (unknown condition/circumstances). During an interior search of the structure, sadly, firefighters found one person deceased (age/gender/circumstances unknown). LAFD's Fire Investigators are responding to investigate this fatality fire and attempt to identify a cause. PIO Captain Cody Weireter is en route, ETA 11:30pm.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AR1 AR7 BC10 BC12 E275 E298 E75 E81 E98 PI3 RA75 RA898 RA98 SO1 T75 T98; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1611; 10:27PM; 13574 W Gager St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TSw37k; #Pacoima; Heavy fire showing from a detached structure (garage? converted?) to the rear of a one-story single-family home.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E275 E298 E75 E81 E98 RA75 RA898 RA98 T75 T98; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0784; 12:36PM; Haines Canyon Ave; MAP: https://bit.ly/49gXCeK; #Tujunga; Firefighters located a 19-year-old male in a remote area, with an arm injury sustained during cycling. Ground crews were unable to bring apparatus to the patient's location, therefore LAFD Air Operations utilized a hoist operation. A rescuer was lowered down to the patient to assess, treat, and prepare the patient for a hoist. LAFD Air Operations hoisted and transported the patient by air to a local hospital. Nothing further.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E24 E274 H4 H7 HA4 HA7 PB74 RA77 RA874 RH114 T74; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Aircraft Emergency - DRILL ONLY; INC#0344; 07:37AM; Burbank Airport; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VAxhVN; Burbank; Several public safety agencies are conducting a large-scale drill at Burbank Airport today, including your LAFD. In the case of an actual emergency, those who are signed up for Incident Alerts at LAFD.org/Alerts will receive these notifications. This training will better prepare first responders for responding to an aircraft emergency, and help practice interoperability between agencies with regards to communications and tactics. There is no actual Aircraft Emergency at this time.; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; BC14 CM2 EM14 HL1 HL2; CH8; 16; Nicholas Prange

Complete - River Rescue; INC#1201; 05:38PM; Los Angeles River East of Laurel Canyon Blvd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/YVgEchDCDax5MoUWA; #StudioCity; After being thrown a flotation device and briefly holding onto the lower portion of a 24' wooden ladder lowered by the first arriving LAFD crew along the vertical concrete wall of the Los Angeles River, the 35-year-old woman was again swept a short distance downstream by the 15 mile-per-hour flow of stormwater, before being rescued by an LAFD Rescue Helicopter crew using a hoist cable and harness. She and her LAFD rescuer have been safely hoisted aboard the aircraft where she will receive continuous in-flight care for minor injuries, including hypothermia, during direct helicopter transport to an area hospital. The woman has confirmed there were no other persons or animals with her, or known by her to be in peril.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC11 BC14 BC2 CM20 CM22 E203 E227 E235 E250 E273 E278 E288 E35 E42 E55 E56 E76 E86 E88 EM5 H4 H6 HA4 HA6 HR3 RA56 RA850 RA878 T27 T3 T35 T50 T73 T78 T88 UR88; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

River Rescue; INC#1201; 05:03PM; Los Angeles River x Laurel Canyon Blvd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/YVgEchDCDax5MoUWA; #StudioCity; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response, following a sudden rainstorm, to an adult female first discovered in the concrete-lined Los Angeles River flood control channel near Whitsett Avenue "less than knee depth" water that was moving at approximately 15 miles-per-hour. She was thrown a flotation device by responders, and is reportedly moving slowly downstream, last seen 400 yards west of Laurel Canyon Boulevard (5:28 PM), where she has reportedly been able to stand briefly, before being destabilized by the water.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC2 CM20 CM22 E203 E235 E250 E273 E278 E288 E35 E42 E55 E56 E76 E88 EM5 H4 H6 HA4 HA6 HR3 RA56 RA850 RA878 T3 T35 T50 T73 T78 T88 UR88; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey
